title: Barcelona defender Pique on referendum vote
description:
(1 Oct 2017) Football player for FC Barcelona and the Spanish national team Gerard Pique couldn't hold back tears as he talked about the incidents in Catalonia on Sunday. 
Spanish riot police smashed their way into polling stations across Catalonia to try and stop Sunday's referendum, sometimes beating voters. 
Catalonia's health services say 761 people were injured by police on Sunday, with two of them in serious condition.
Pique said he was proud of the Catalan people and said that he was ready to quit the Spanish national team if anyone from the football federation thought he was "a problem" or "an annoyance".
However, Pique said he thought he could stay in the national team, because "there are a lot of people in Spain who disapprove of these events that happened in Catalonia and who believe in democracy."
